course.subject: MATH
course.name: Independent Study: Atmospheric Dynamics
course.description: The objective of this independent study course is to prepare students in applying the knowledge of vector calculus and differential equations to the study of atmospheres, for the Earth, planets, or stars. This involves learning basic principles concerning thermodynamics, radiation transfer, primitive equations of motion, as well as cloud microphysics. Assessment includes: computational exercises, a written test, and a presentation. Students need instructor's approval to take this course.
course.prerequisites: MATH 2023 AND MATH 2121 AND MATH 2352
